newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: South American port conditions - Lloyds.
newsitem.headline: South American port conditions - Lloyds.

text.p: Port conditions from Lloyds Shipping Intelligence Service --

ARGENTINA, June 17 - Santa Fe - No vessels berthed, none in roads, none due. Max. recommended draft 26 ft. 1 in at access channel. Diamante - One vessel berthed loading soda, no vessels in roads, none due. Max. recommended draft 26 ft. 1 in. at passage KM 520. San Lorenzo - Seven vessels berthed, all loading, of which 2 sbm, 1 sun pellets, 1 by-products, 1 cotton oil, 1 maize, 1 sbo. 5 Vessels in roads, 35 due at 6 terminals during this week and next. Forecast indicates that draft is rising approx. 0.5 metres next week. Pasa berth draft 20 ft. 2 ins. Fw.

Rosario - Six vessels berthed of which 2 loading maize, 3 discharging fertiliser, 1 loading sbmp. 2 Vessels in roads, 11 due within this week and next. Forecast indicates that draft is rising approx. 0.5 metres during next week. Villa Constitucion - No vessels berthed, none in roads, 4 due. Elevator berths Max. draft 22 ft Fw. San Nicolas - Five vessels berthed of which 3 discharging (2 steel products, 1 iron ore). 1 Loading ferro-silicon, 1 awaiting orders, 1 in roads, 5 due within the next week. Forecast indicates that draft will fall approx. 0.15 metres during next week. San Pedro - No vessels berthed, none in roads, none due.

San Lorenzo/Rosario/San Nicolas/San Pedro - Max. recommended draft 32 ft. 06 ins./33 ft. 00 ins. Fw (high tide). Buenos Aires - 15 Vessels in port, 25 due within the next week. Max. recommended draft 31 ft. 06 ins. high tide Naabsa (guided by entrance channel). Dock sud max. recommended draft 28/29 ft. Fw. high tide Naabsa (guided by entrance channel). Necochea - Six vessels berthed of which 4 loading (1 wheat, 2 maize 1 tar-oil). 2 Discharging dap, 11 Vessels in roads, 13 due over the next week. Max. recommended draft at entrance channel 40 ft. 0 ins. Bw. Bahia Blanca - Nine vessels berthed of which 7 loading (1 wheat, 2 fish, 1 naphtha, 1 lpg, 2 barley). 2 Awaiting orders, 5 in roads, 26 due within the next week. Drafts vary for individual berths.

BRAZIL, June 17 - Vitoria - Five vessels berthed of which 2 bulk wheat dischargers, 1 cellulose loader, 1 container/general cargo loader/discharger, 1 granite loader. Tubarao - 3 Iron ore loaders, 1 fuel oil discharger. Praia Mole - 2 Steel products loaders, 1 coal discharger. Portocel/Ubu - No vessels, 19 waiting in roads. Santos - 26 Vessels berthed of which 2 full container loader/dischargers, 1 full container loader, 1 bulk cement, 2 bulk chemical products dischargers, 1 bulk lpg discharger, 2 bulk chemical products loaders/dischargers, 1 general cargo loader/discharger, 1 bulk diesel oil loader, 2 fertiliser dischargers, 7 sugar loaders, 2 bulk juice loaders, 2 bulk wheat dischargers, 1 bulk sulphur loader, 1 general cargo/container loader/discharger. 84 Vessels due over the next 7 days. Private terminals - Cosipa - 1 Bulk coal discharger, 1 steel products loader. Ultrafertil - 1 Bulk sulphur discharger.

Rio Grande - Eight vessels berthed of which 2 full container loaders, 2 soy loaders, 1 soy bean loader, 1 wood-chip loader, 1 acid discharger, 1 fertiliser discharger. 1 Vessel waiting in roads, 21 due over the next 10 days. Rio de Janeiro - 10 Vessels berthed of which 1 general cargo/steel products discharger, 2 wheat dischargers, 1 general cargo discharger, 1 steel products discharger, 1 paper discharger, 1 bulker discharger, 1 oil discharger, 1 general cargo loader, 1 sugar loader. Tecon - 3 Vessels, 30 due over the next 7 days. Paranagua - 15 Vessels berthed of which 3 fertiliser dischargers, 4 general cargo dischargers, 2 sugar loaders, 3 pellets loaders, 1 soy loader, 2 general cargo. 22 Vessels waiting in roads of which to load, 9 sugar, 4 pellets, 3 soy. To discharge, 2 fertiliser, 2 general cargo. 36 Vessels due over the next 7 days. Sao Sebastiao - Tebar - 3 Vessels berthed. Commercial quay - 1 Vessel, 3 waiting in roads, 5 due over the next 7 days.

CHILE, June 16 - Arica - One vessel berthed, 5 berths vacant. 6 Vessels due during the week. Iquique - Six vessels berthed and operating, 1 berth vacant. 9 Vessels due during the week. Antofagasta - Five vessels berthed, 2 berths vacant. 16 Vessels due during the week to load/discharge concentrates, bulk copper, containers and general cargo. Valparaiso - Four vessels berthed and operating, 5 berths vacant. Pier 2 out of service for maintenance until April 1998. 14 Vessels due during the week. San Antonio - Four vessels in port operating, 5 berths vacant. 16 Vessels due during the week. Puerto Montt - Two vessels in port, 5 due during the week. Punta Arenas - Three vessels berthed, 10 due during the week.

Conception Bay ports - 14 Vessels due during this week at different terminals. Talcahuano - One vessel berthed, 5 due this week. No vessels in roads. San Vicente - Two vessels berthed and operating, 5 due this week. Navy pier (Molo 500) - 1 Vessel berthed, 1 due this week. Steel pier - 1 Vessel berthed, none due this week. Coronel pier - 1 vessel berthed, 1 due this week. Oil terminal - 1 Vessel berthed, none due this week. Lirquen - Five vessels berthed, 1 berth vacant. 3 Vessels due during the week. Penco - One vessel berthed, none due this week.

PERU, June 16 - No strikes at any port. Callao - Four vessels anchored. 7 General cargo/container vessels berthed, no berthing delays. Paita - No vessels anchored. 2 Container/fish meal vessels berthed, no berthing delays. Bayovar - No vessels anchored. 1 Petroleum vessel berthed, no berthing delays. Talara - Two vessels anchored, 1 oil tanker berth. No berthing delays. Chimbote - Three vessels anchored, 4 fish meal vessels berthed. No berthing delays. Pisco - No vessels, no delays. Ilo - One vessel anchored. No vessels berthed, no delays.

VENEZUELA, June 16 - Puerto Cabello - Four vessels anchored. 15 Vessels berthed of which 8 grain, 4 general cargo, 3 containers. Piers 1 and 2 closed, pier platforms 25-29 being re-paved from 2/6 with estimated time for completion 90 days and the flagstones of piers 8-11 changed with estimated time for completion 45 days. Guanta - Five vessels anchored, 4 general cargo vessels berthed. June 17 - All ports working normally. Orinoco river draft at 17/6 35 ft. 0 ins. Puerto Ordaz - One vessel loading iron pellets, 3 vessels due. Palua - One vessel due. Venalum - One vessel loading aluminium, 1 vessel due.

Matanzas - Four vessels operating of which 3 loading steel products, 1 discharging scrap. 3 Vessels due. San Felix - One vessel loading/discharging general cargo. Interalumina - One vessel loading alumina, 1 due. Punta Cuchillo - Three vessels due. Puerto Cabello - 18 Vessels operating of which 16 loading/discharging general cargo, 1 discharging sugar, 1 discharging fertiliser. 4 Vessels waiting at anchorage to discharge, 1 under repair, 11 due. Venterminales - One vessel due. Borburata - One vessel due. Bajo Grande - One vessel loading refined products, 2 due. Guanta - Four vessels operating, all discharging, of which 1 wheat, 1 barley, 1 pipes, 1 salt. 8 Vessels due. La Guaira - One vessel loading/discharging general cargo, 4 due, 3 under repair, 1 passenger vessel. Amuay - Four vessels waiting at anchorage to load, 3 loading refined products, 1 due. Cardon - Four vessels loading refined products, 1 waiting at anchorage to load. Guaranao - One vessel loading/discharging general cargo.
